post.description:
Generate a challenge for wallet signature authentication

    Request body:
    {
        "wallet": "0x123..."
    }

    Returns:
    {
        "timestamp": 1732136789,
        "message": "Sign in to HyperCLI

Timestamp: 1732136789
Wallet: 0x123..."
    }

    The timestamp is used to prevent replay attacks. The signature must be verified
    within WALLET_LOGIN_TIMEOUT seconds (default: 60s).

Verify wallet signature and return JWT token

Request body:
{
    "wallet": "0x123...",
    "signature": "0xabc...",
    "timestamp": 1732136789
}

Returns:
{
    "token": "eyJ...",
    "expires_in": 2592000
}

This endpoint:
1. Verifies the timestamp is within WALLET_LOGIN_TIMEOUT seconds
2. Recovers the signing address from the signature
3. Verifies it matches the provided wallet address
4. Creates a new FREE user if this is their first login
5. Returns a JWT token (with user_id, wallet, login_type) valid for 30 days

The client is responsible for storing the token in cookies (same as Turnkey /auth/login).

Process a top-up payment (paid via x402).

This endpoint is protected by x402 middleware which verifies the payment signature
and settles it in the background. The middleware ensures the payment is valid
before this endpoint is called.

SECURITY: The actual amount credited is extracted from the VERIFIED X-PAYMENT header
(the signed payment payload), NOT from the request body. The request body amount
is ignored to prevent attackers from claiming a larger amount than they paid.

Request body:
{
    "user_id": "uuid",
    "amount": 10.00  (informational only - actual amount from X-PAYMENT header)
}

Returns:
{
    "user_id": "uuid",
    "amount": 10.00,  (actual verified amount from payment)
    "wallet": "0x123...",
    "transaction_id": "uuid",
    "message": "Top-up of $10.00 received successfully!"
}

get.description:
Get the current user's account balance breakdown.

Returns your total balance split into paid balance and rewards balance,
along with pending reservations (funds reserved for running jobs) and
available balance (what you can spend on new jobs/renders).

**Balance Types:**
- `balance`: Paid balance from top-ups
- `rewards_balance`: Bonus credits (welcome bonus, promotions)
- `total_balance`: Sum of paid + rewards
- `pending_reservations`: Funds reserved for active jobs
- `available_balance`: Total minus reservations (spendable amount)

**Example Response:**
```json
{
  "balance": "1.50",
  "rewards_balance": "0.10",
  "total_balance": "1.60",
  "pending_reservations": "0.50",
  "available_balance": "1.10"
}
```

**SDK:**
```python
balance = c3.billing.balance()
print(f"Available: ${balance.available_balance}")
```

**CLI:**
```bash
c3 billing balance
```

**Keywords:** balance, credits, funds, money, account, wallet, available, spending

Get your transaction history with optional filters.

Lists all billing transactions including top-ups, job charges, render charges,
refunds, and adjustments. Transactions show the flow of funds in your account.

**Transaction Types:**
- `TOP_UP`: Added funds to account
- `JOB`: Charge for GPU compute job
- `RENDER`: Charge for image/video render
- `REFUND`: Refund for cancelled job or failed render
- `ADJUSTMENT`: Manual balance adjustment

**Transaction Statuses:**
- `PENDING`: Reserved funds (e.g., job in progress)
- `PROCESSING`: Being processed
- `COMPLETED`: Finalized transaction
- `FAILED`: Transaction failed (funds returned)

**SDK:**
```python
txs = c3.billing.transactions()
for tx in txs:
    print(f"{tx.transaction_type}: ${tx.amount_usd}")
```

**CLI:**
```bash
c3 billing transactions
c3 billing transactions --type JOB --status COMPLETED
```

**Keywords:** transactions, history, charges, payments, billing, spending, costs, usage

get.description:
Get details of a specific transaction by its UUID.

Returns the full transaction record including amount, type, status,
and any associated metadata (e.g., job_id for job charges).

**SDK:**
```python
tx = c3.billing.transaction("tx-uuid-here")
print(f"Amount: ${tx.amount_usd}")
print(f"Type: {tx.transaction_type}")
```

**Keywords:** transaction, charge, payment, receipt, billing detail

List your invoices for enterprise billing.

Invoices are used for enterprise customers who pay via invoice rather than
prepaid credits. Most users will not have any invoices.

**Invoice Statuses:**
- `DRAFT`: Invoice being prepared
- `ISSUED`: Invoice sent, awaiting payment
- `PROCESSING`: Payment being processed
- `PAID`: Invoice paid and settled
- `VOID`: Invoice cancelled

**SDK:**
```python
invoices = c3.billing.invoices()
for inv in invoices:
    print(f"Invoice {inv.invoice_id}: ${inv.amount_usd} - {inv.status}")
```

**Keywords:** invoices, billing, enterprise, payment, accounting

parameters.name: status

schema.description: Filter by status: DRAFT, ISSUED, PROCESSING, PAID, VOID
schema.title: Status

parameters.description: Filter by status: DRAFT, ISSUED, PROCESSING, PAID, VOID

get.description:
Get details of a specific invoice by its UUID.

Returns the full invoice record including amount, status, due date,
and any associated transactions.

**SDK:**
```python
invoice = c3.billing.invoice("invoice-uuid-here")
print(f"Amount: ${invoice.amount_usd}")
print(f"Status: {invoice.status}")
print(f"Due: {invoice.due_date}")
```

**Keywords:** invoice, billing, enterprise, payment detail

Get your account profile information.

Returns your user profile including account type, login method,
email verification status, and wallet address (if applicable).

**User Types:**
- `free`: New users with welcome bonus only
- `rewards`: Users with reward credits
- `paid`: Users who have added funds

**Login Types:**
- `turnkey`: Email/passkey authentication
- `wallet`: Ethereum wallet signature
- `free`: Guest account from homepage

**Example Response:**
```json
{
  "user_id": "uuid",
  "name": "John Doe",
  "email": "john@example.com",
  "email_verified": true,
  "wallet_address": "0x123...",
  "user_type": "paid",
  "login_type": "wallet"
}
```

**SDK:**
```python
user = c3.user.get()
print(f"Account type: {user.user_type}")
```

**Keywords:** user, profile, account, settings, whoami, me

patch.description:
Update your account profile (name and email).

You can update your display name and email address. Changing your email
will reset the email_verified flag until you verify the new address.

**Request Body:**
```json
{
  "name": "New Name",
  "email": "new@example.com"
}
```

**SDK:**
```python
user = c3.user.update(name="New Name", email="new@example.com")
```

**Keywords:** update, profile, settings, name, email, account

post.description:
Create a new GPU compute job.

Launches a Docker container on GPU infrastructure with per-second billing.
Funds are reserved from your balance when the job is created and settled
when the job completes (unused time is refunded).

**Required Parameters:**
- `gpu_type`: GPU model (L40S, H100, A100, etc.)
- `gpu_count`: Number of GPUs (1, 2, 4, 8)
- `docker_image`: Docker image to run
- `command`: Base64-encoded command to execute

**Optional Parameters:**
- `region`: Region code (kr, fi, va) - uses cheapest if not specified
- `runtime`: Max runtime in seconds - uses max affordable if not specified
- `interruptible`: Use spot instances for lower cost (default: true)
- `env_vars`: Environment variables as key-value pairs
- `ports`: Port mappings (use "lb": port for HTTPS load balancer)
- `auth`: Enable JWT authentication on load balancer (default: false)

**Example Request:**
```json
{
  "gpu_type": "L40S",
  "gpu_count": 1,
  "docker_image": "pytorch/pytorch:2.0.0-cuda11.7-runtime",
  "command": "cHl0aG9uIHRyYWluLnB5",
  "runtime": 3600,
  "env_vars": {"WANDB_API_KEY": "xxx"},
  "ports": {"lb": 8080}
}
```

**SDK:**
```python
job = c3.jobs.create(
    image="pytorch/pytorch:2.0.0-cuda11.7-runtime",
    command="python train.py",
    gpu_type="L40S",
    gpu_count=1,
    runtime=3600,
)
print(f"Job {job.job_id} created at ${job.price_per_hour}/hr")
```

**CLI:**
```bash
c3 instances launch pytorch/pytorch:2.0.0 -g L40S -c "python train.py"
```

**Keywords:** create, job, run, launch, start, deploy, GPU, compute, container, docker, train, inference

get.description:
List all your GPU compute jobs.

Returns all jobs you've created, optionally filtered by state.
Jobs are returned with full details including pricing and timestamps.

**Job States:**
- `pending`: Job created, waiting for resources
- `queued`: In queue for available GPU
- `running`: Currently executing on GPU
- `succeeded`: Completed successfully
- `failed`: Execution failed
- `canceled`: Manually cancelled
- `terminated`: Terminated (timeout or preemption)

**SDK:**
```python
# List all jobs
jobs = c3.jobs.list()

# List only running jobs
jobs = c3.jobs.list(state="running")

for job in jobs:
    print(f"{job.job_id}: {job.state} - ${job.price_per_hour}/hr")
```

**CLI:**
```bash
c3 jobs list
c3 jobs list --state running
```

**Keywords:** list, jobs, history, running, status, all

parameters.name: state

schema.description: Filter by state: pending, queued, running, succeeded, failed, canceled, terminated
schema.title: State

parameters.description: Filter by state: pending, queued, running, succeeded, failed, canceled, terminated

get.description:
Get details of a specific job by ID.

Returns full job information including state, GPU configuration,
pricing, hostname (when running), and timestamps.

**Response includes:**
- `state`: Current job state
- `hostname`: Public hostname for load-balanced ports (when running)
- `price_per_hour` / `price_per_second`: Billing rates
- `runtime`: Maximum runtime in seconds
- `created_at`, `started_at`, `completed_at`: Timestamps

**SDK:**
```python
job = c3.jobs.get("job-uuid")
print(f"State: {job.state}")
print(f"Hostname: {job.hostname}")
```

**CLI:**
```bash
c3 jobs get <job_id>
```

**Keywords:** get, job, status, details, info

patch.description:
Extend a running job's maximum runtime.

Increases the job's runtime limit. Additional funds will be reserved
from your balance for the extension. The new runtime must be greater
than the current runtime.

**Request Body:**
```json
{
  "runtime": 7200
}
```

**SDK:**
```python
# Extend job to 2 hours total runtime
job = c3.jobs.extend("job-uuid", runtime=7200)
print(f"New runtime: {job.runtime}s")
```

**CLI:**
```bash
c3 jobs extend <job_id> 7200
```

**Keywords:** extend, runtime, time, duration, longer, more time

delete.description:
Cancel a running or pending job.

Stops the job immediately. Unused reserved funds are refunded to your
balance (you only pay for actual compute time used).

**Response:**
```json
{
  "status": "canceled",
  "job_id": "uuid"
}
```

**SDK:**
```python
c3.jobs.cancel("job-uuid")
```

**CLI:**
```bash
c3 jobs cancel <job_id>
```

**Keywords:** cancel, stop, terminate, kill, abort, delete, job

get.description:
Get stdout/stderr logs from a job.

Returns the combined stdout and stderr output from your container.
For real-time streaming logs, use the WebSocket endpoint instead.

**Response:**
```json
{
  "job_id": "uuid",
  "logs": "Starting training...\nEpoch 1/10..."
}
```

**SDK:**
```python
logs = c3.jobs.logs("job-uuid")
print(logs)
```

**CLI:**
```bash
c3 jobs logs <job_id>
```

**WebSocket (streaming):**
```
wss://api.hypercli.com/ws/logs/<job_key>
```

**Keywords:** logs, output, stdout, stderr, print, debug, console

Get authentication token for a job with auth enabled.

For jobs created with `auth=true`, this returns a Bearer token that
must be included in requests to the job's HTTPS endpoint.

**Prerequisites:**
- Job must have been created with `auth: true`
- Job must be in `running` state

**Response:**
```json
{
  "job_id": "uuid",
  "token": "eyJ...",
  "hostname": "job-hostname.hypercli.com"
}
```

**Usage:**
```python
import requests

token_info = c3.jobs.token("job-uuid")

response = requests.get(
    f"https://{token_info.hostname}/api/data",
    headers={"Authorization": f"Bearer {token_info.token}"}
)
```

**CLI:**
```bash
c3 jobs token <job_id>
```

**Keywords:** token, auth, authentication, bearer, JWT, secure, access

Get real-time GPU and system metrics for a running job.

Returns current utilization statistics for GPUs and system resources.
Only available for jobs in `running` state.

**GPU Metrics (per GPU):**
- `utilization_gpu_percent`: GPU compute utilization %
- `memory_used_mb` / `memory_total_mb`: VRAM usage
- `temperature_c`: GPU temperature
- `power_draw_w`: Power consumption

**System Metrics:**
- `cpu_percent`: CPU utilization %
- `memory_used_mb` / `memory_limit_mb`: RAM usage

**Example Response:**
```json
{
  "gpus": [{
    "index": 0,
    "name": "NVIDIA L40S",
    "utilization_gpu_percent": 95.0,
    "memory_used_mb": 40000,
    "memory_total_mb": 46080,
    "temperature_c": 72,
    "power_draw_w": 280
  }],
  "system": {
    "cpu_percent": 45.0,
    "memory_used_mb": 8192,
    "memory_limit_mb": 32768
  }
}
```

**SDK:**
```python
metrics = c3.jobs.metrics("job-uuid")
for gpu in metrics.gpus:
    print(f"GPU {gpu.index}: {gpu.utilization_gpu_percent}%")
```

**Keywords:** metrics, GPU, utilization, memory, VRAM, temperature, power, monitoring, stats

post.description:
Create a new image or video render using GPU-accelerated templates.

Runs a render job using pre-configured templates. Funds are reserved from
your balance and charged on completion.

**Request Body:**
```json
{
  "type": "comfyui",
  "params": {
    "template": "video_wan2_2_14B_t2v",
    "prompt": "a cat in space",
    "width": 720,
    "height": 720,
    "gpu_type": "rtxpro6000"
  },
  "notify_url": "https://myapp.com/webhook"
}
```

**Required Params:**
- `template`: Template name (see Available Templates below)
- `prompt`: Text prompt for generation

**Available Templates:**
- Image: hidream_i1_full, hidream_i1_fast, flux_schnell, flux_dev
- Video: video_wan2_2_14B_t2v, video_wan2_2_1_3B_t2v, video_hunyuan

**Available GPU Types** (case-insensitive):
- rtxpro6000, rtx6000ada, a6000, l40s, l4, a100_40, a100_80, h100, h200, b200, b300
- See /instances/gpus for current pricing

**Optional Params:**
- `width` / `height`: Image/video dimensions
- `steps`: Inference steps (default: 50)
- `cfg`: CFG scale (default: 5.0)
- `gpu_type`: GPU model (default: l40s)
- `region`: Region code (kr, fi, va)
- `notify_url`: Webhook URL for completion notification

**SDK:**
```python
render = c3.renders.create(
    params={
        "template": "video_wan2_2_14B_t2v",
        "prompt": "a cat in space",
        "gpu_type": "rtxpro6000",
    }
)
print(f"Render ID: {render.id}")
```

**CLI:**
```bash
c3 renders create video_wan2_2_14B_t2v -p "a cat in space" --gpu rtxpro6000
```

**Keywords:** render, image, video, generate, create, AI art, ComfyUI, HiDream, Flux, Wan, Hunyuan

get.description:
List all your renders with optional filters.

Returns a paginated list of your render jobs, optionally filtered
by state, template, or type.

**Query Parameters:**
- `state`: Filter by render state
- `template`: Filter by template name (e.g., video_wan2_2_14B_t2v, hidream_i1_full)
- `type`: Filter by render type (e.g., comfyui)

**SDK:**
```python
# List all renders
renders = c3.renders.list()

# List only completed renders
renders = c3.renders.list(state="completed")

# List renders for a specific template
renders = c3.renders.list(template="video_wan2_2_14B_t2v")
```

**CLI:**
```bash
c3 renders list
c3 renders list --state completed
```

**Keywords:** list, renders, history, images, gallery, all

parameters.name: state

schema.description: Filter by state: pending, running, completed, failed
schema.title: State

parameters.description: Filter by state: pending, running, completed, failed

get.description:
Get full details of a render by ID.

Returns complete render information including state, parameters,
result URL (when completed), and error message (if failed).

**Render States:**
- `pending`: Waiting for GPU resources
- `running`: Currently rendering
- `completed`: Finished successfully (result_url available)
- `failed`: Render failed (error message available)

**SDK:**
```python
render = c3.renders.get("render-uuid")
if render.state == "completed":
    print(f"Result: {render.result_url}")
```

**CLI:**
```bash
c3 renders get <render_id>
```

**Keywords:** render, get, details, status, result, image

delete.description:
Cancel a pending render.

Cancels a render that hasn't started yet. Only `pending` renders
can be cancelled. Running renders must complete or timeout.

**Response:**
```json
{
  "status": "deleted",
  "id": "render-uuid"
}
```

**SDK:**
```python
c3.renders.cancel("render-uuid")
```

**CLI:**
```bash
c3 renders cancel <render_id>
```

**Keywords:** cancel, delete, abort, stop, render

get.description:
Get lightweight render status for polling.

Returns minimal status information optimized for frequent polling.
Use this endpoint when waiting for render completion instead of
fetching full render details repeatedly.

**Response:**
```json
{
  "id": "render-uuid",
  "state": "running",
  "result_url": null
}
```

**Polling Example:**
```python
import time

while True:
    status = c3.renders.status("render-uuid")
    if status.state in ("completed", "failed"):
        break
    time.sleep(2)

if status.result_url:
    print(f"Done: {status.result_url}")
```

**Keywords:** status, poll, progress, wait, check, render

post.description:
Generate an image from a text prompt using Qwen-Image.

Simple one-prompt interface. Uses optimized defaults:
- Model: Qwen-Image (excellent text rendering)
- GPU: L40S in Korea
- Size: 1328x1328

**Request:** `{"prompt": "a cat wearing sunglasses", "width": 1024, "height": 1024, "notify_url": "https://..."}`

**Returns:** Render object with `id` to poll for status.

**Keywords:** image, generate, text-to-image, t2i, qwen, picture

Generate an image from a text prompt using HiDream I1 Full.

Simple one-prompt interface. Uses optimized defaults:
- Model: HiDream I1 Full (highest quality, 50 steps)
- GPU: L40S in Korea
- Size: 1024x1024

**Request:** `{"prompt": "a mystical forest at sunset", "width": 1024, "height": 1024, "notify_url": "https://..."}`

**Returns:** Render object with `id` to poll for status.

**Keywords:** image, generate, text-to-image, t2i, hidream, picture, art

Generate a video from a text prompt using Wan 2.2.

Simple one-prompt interface. Uses optimized defaults:
- Model: Wan 2.2 14B Text-to-Video
- GPU: RTX PRO 6000 in Finland
- Size: 640x640, 81 frames

**Request:** `{"prompt": "a cat walking through a garden", "width": 1024, "height": 1024, "notify_url": "https://..."}`

**Returns:** Render object with `id` to poll for status.

**Keywords:** video, generate, text-to-video, t2v, wan, animation

Animate an image into a video using Wan 2.2 Animate.

Simple interface for image-to-video. Uses optimized defaults:
- Model: Wan 2.2 14B Animate
- GPU: RTX PRO 6000 in Finland

**Request:**
```json
{
    "prompt": "the character is dancing",
    "image_url": "https://example.com/character.png",
    "notify_url": "https://..."
}
```

**Returns:** Render object with `id` to poll for status.

**Keywords:** video, animate, image-to-video, i2v, wan, motion

Generate a speaking/lip-sync video using HuMo.

Creates a video with synchronized lip movements from an image and audio.
Uses optimized defaults:
- Model: HuMo 17B (audio-driven lip sync)
- GPU: RTX PRO 6000 in Finland

**Request:**
```json
{
    "prompt": "A person speaking to the camera",
    "image_url": "https://example.com/face.png",
    "audio_url": "https://example.com/speech.mp3",
    "notify_url": "https://..."
}
```

**Returns:** Render object with `id` to poll for status.

**Keywords:** video, speaking, lip-sync, audio, humo, talking head

Transform images using Qwen Image Edit with 1-3 input images.

Accepts 1-3 images for editing, style transfer, or guided generation.
Uses optimized defaults:
- Model: Qwen Image Edit 2509
- GPU: L40S in Korea

**Request:**
```json
{
    "prompt": "Apply the artistic style from the references",
    "image_urls": [
        "https://example.com/subject.jpg",
        "https://example.com/style1.jpg",
        "https://example.com/style2.jpg"
    ],
    "notify_url": "https://..."
}
```

**Returns:** Render object with `id` to poll for status.

**Keywords:** image, edit, style transfer, transform, qwen

Generate a video morphing between two images using Wan 2.2.

Creates smooth transitions between start and end frames.
Uses optimized defaults:
- Model: Wan 2.2 14B First/Last Frame
- GPU: RTX PRO 6000 in Finland

**Request:**
```json
{
    "prompt": "smooth transition from day to night",
    "start_image_url": "https://example.com/day.png",
    "end_image_url": "https://example.com/night.png",
    "notify_url": "https://..."
}
```

**Returns:** Render object with `id` to poll for status.

**Keywords:** video, morph, transition, first-last-frame, wan

Upload a file using multipart form data (synchronous).

This endpoint blocks until upload completes. For async uploads, use /url or /b64.

**Keywords:** upload, file, multipart, form

Upload a file from a URL (async).

Returns immediately with state=processing. Poll GET /files/{id} for completion.

**Request:**
```json
{"url": "https://example.com/image.jpg", "path": "optional/prefix"}
```

**Keywords:** upload, url, fetch, remote, async

Upload a file from base64-encoded data (async).

Returns immediately with state=processing. Poll GET /files/{id} for completion.

**Request:**
```json
{
    "data": "base64-encoded-content",
    "filename": "image.jpg",
    "content_type": "image/jpeg",
    "path": "optional/prefix"
}
```

**Keywords:** upload, base64, b64, encoded, async

get.description:
Get file metadata and status.

Use this to poll for completion after async upload.

**Keywords:** file, get, status, poll

delete.description:

Removes the file from storage and database.

UserType.title: UserType
UserType.description:
User types that determine LLM model access:
- FREE: Default for all new users (free-models access group)
- REWARDS: Users with reward balance (free-models + c3-models access groups)
- PAID: Users with paid balance (all-proxy-models - full access)

Note: DB stores UPPERCASE, API returns lowercase via serializer
